creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: Seiyôkan Umeyo {Fusu tatsu no / kumo akeharau / harukaze ni / miyako no sora no / hatsuhi nodokeshi} (Clouds surrounding / a recumbent dragon / are parted by spring breezes, / as the skies are calm / on New Year's day in the capital. Transl. John Carpenter)
markings: Unidentified collecter's seal was on the original mat.
medium: Woodblock print (surimono), ink and color on paper
signed: {Nansô tôka Hokkei ga} (drawn by Hokkei in lamplight in southern Kazusa Province [modern Chiba])
title: Liu Bang Kills the White Serpent
